I have searched all over the web but I have not found
a solution to this problem  just other people with the
same problem.  Here it is.

I am using the junit ant task to run JUnit tests in my
build.  Here is what my junit target looks like.

<target name="unit" depends="compile">
  <junit printsummary="yes" fork="yes">
    <classpath refid="project.classpath"/>
    <formatter type="xml"/>
    <batchtest todir="${distribute_dir}">
      <fileset dir="${build_dir}">
        <include name="**/*TestCase.class"/>
      </fileset>
    </batchtest>
  </junit>
</target>

It tries to run all my test cases but for each one I
get a error in the TEST-[objname].xml file stating the
following


<error message="[objname]"
type="java.lang.ClassNotFoundException">java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:[objname]

	at
java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:199)

	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native
Method)

	at
java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:187)

	at
java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:289)

	at
sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:274)

	at
java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:235)

	at
java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:302)

	at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)

	at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:141)

</error>

all my classes and jars on on the classpath so I am at
a complete lost.  Anyone out there that has seen this
know how to fix it? 

Thanks
Dave
